channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12207] A script to help keep your Git repo fresh
item.description:
I have a script that does a 

git pull --rebase

on each tracking branch, and then attempts an automatic rebase of each local branch against its tracking branch. It also prompts you to delete local branches for HBASE- JIRAs that have been closed. I think this script may help to enforce good Git practices. It may be a good candidate to be included in dev-support/.
item.summary: A script to help keep your Git repo fresh

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Just waiting on another patch to be committed and I will add docs for this and submit a patch.
Patch includes the script and docs.

Added a small check to be sure the directory you passed in actually exists. Already had that check for using the default directory.
Apologies for the patch churn, this version fixes a bug and checks more cleanly for a passed-in directory.
Bash is mean, found another bug.

This message is automatically generated.

Would be great if the script was executable by default.
Also the base dir can be found by using http://stackoverflow.com/questions/59895/can-a-bash-script-tell-what-directory-its-stored-in that would keep people from having to edit a file.

echo $1|sed 's/ *$//'

I think this could be ${1// *$/} instead.

The script gives a lot of warning messages (from git) if you have a dirty workspace, it tried to do several checkouts and rebases for me. Maybe detect that and abort if that starts to happen? This might be difficult to do though, in which case I'm not really insistent on it.

Elliott Clark, I didn't want to make it a requirement to run the script from within the Git repository. Also, I did set the script executable before I made the patch. I don't really understand how Git loses that.

Mike Drob Do you reckon I should fail the script if the first rebase attempt fails? I do abort a rebase if it fails, but move on to the next one. It won't do anything crazy that I know of. Am I missing something?
Elliott Clark You don't have to set the default directory, you can just provide the directory for your Git repo as an argument.
Mike Drob I can't get your sed statement to work. Can you give me the full syntax of what should be in the test statement?

Some Bash style edits, added a check to see if the local git repo is dirty, and processing the command line arguments better. Also you can do -d <git_directory> and it checks to see if it is actually a Git directory.
Version 5 fixes closed JIRA detection, which I inadvertently cleaned up with the last patch. Also made sure to use spaces for indentation.

This message is automatically generated.

Some feedback:

  • Please use 2 character spaces for indentation (and 4 for line continuations).
  • Maybe make the usage message a function (cat with a here document) since then you can check for if someone passes too many arguments when parsing command line arguments.
  • Passing an invalid argument to the script should output the usage message (to stderr) and then exit 1.
  • Put variable subtitution (e.g. on line 44) in double quotes to protect against breaking if spaces are passed.
  • On line 81, may want to lowercase everything and check equality instead of checking HBASE- or hbase- (in case someone uses Hbase- or some other weird combo).
  • Consider storing deleted branches in an array instead of concatenating a string. This makes it easier to loop through later, as well.
  • Put spaces on both sides of pipes throughout to clarify what's going on in commands (e.g. line 99).
  • Pretty sure you don't need the trailing backslash on line 134 since you're inside of quotes, but you may want to just have two echos since in the current form, the formatting will be funny (since you have whitespace inside of the quotes).
  • Try to be consistent and use single brackets for conditionals, if possible (if [ ... ]; then versus if [[ ... ]]; then) for us POSIX nerds.
  • Put a space before > on line 120.
  • Forgive me for being so type A. :-p

It's not strictly related to your commit, by the way, but the ref guide's patch section references git squash as if it's a command that can be run at one point. Can you just sort that out (i.e. just say to squash or git rebase -i) since it's relevant to this topic?
Fixed Dima's concerns, split some functionality into functions, now also deals with the time when JIRA is unavailable. Also fixed up the git squash thing.

No further comments. Since this is just a script and not part of HBase itself, I will go ahead and commit it (fixing the tabs in the output on commit).
What I committed to Master.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #5705 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/5705/)
HBASE-12207 A script to help keep your Git repo fresh (mstanleyjones: rev 66b6dd19418bc60216ac9228f52b8c6cbe919dc0)

  • dev-support/rebase_all_git_branches.sh
  • src/main/docbkx/developer.xml
